keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 11, 2019, concerning the installation of new video recording equipment racks at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The work involves replacing old recording systems with new hardware, requiring power, network drops, and IP addresses for the new racks.
The primary goal is to restore recording to all channels, with redundancy and PTZ control to be addressed afterward.
The existing analog matrix switch will remain operational for PTZ control and PLC camera call-up during the transition.
The correspondence is between SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions staff and an unspecified recipient, likely at the Bureau of Prisons or MCC facility.
